title: Justin Phillips (rugby union)
text:
Justin David Phillips (born 3 February 1995) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for the in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> and in the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> and in the <a href="Rugby%20Challenge%20%28South%20Africa%29">Rugby Challenge</a>. His regular position is scrum-half.
Rugby career.
Schoolboy rugby.
Phillips was born in <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a> and represented the at the Under-16 Grant Khomo Week in 2011 and at the Under-18 <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> in 2012 and 2013. In both 2012 and 2013, he was included in a <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa Schools</a> squad after the Craven Week tournament. In 2012, he started matches against <a href="France%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> and <a href="England%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, while in 2013, he started against England and came on as a replacement against <a href="Wales%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>.
Western Province.
After high school, he moved to <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a> to join the Western Province Rugby Institute. He started nine matches for the team during the <a href="2014%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship">2014 Under-19 Provincial Championship</a>, scoring four tries. His first try came in a 21–20 win over before scoring two tries in a 43–24 victory over the s in <a href="Potchefstroom">Potchefstroom</a>. His fourth try came in their 29–22 victory over in the semi-finals to send them to the final, which they also won, beating Phillips' old side the Blue Bulls 33–26.
He made his first class debut during the <a href="2015%20Vodacom%20Cup">2015 Vodacom Cup</a>, coming on as a replacement for Western Province in their 32–12 victory over a . Three more appearances off the bench followed during the play-offs, in victories over a in the quarter finals and the in the semi-finals, as well as in their 7–24 defeat to the in the final of the competition.
Phillips made twelve appearances for in the <a href="2015%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship%20Group%20A">2015 Under-21 Provincial Championship</a>, scoring tries against , , and a brace in their return leg against the Blue Bulls in Cape Town to help his side finish top of the log. He was also in the starting line-up for their semi-final victory over the Golden Lions and their victory in the final over the Free State to win a youth title for the second year in a row.
He appeared for Western Province in the <a href="2016%20Currie%20Cup%20qualification">2016 Currie Cup qualification</a> series, scoring tries in matches against a , the and the .
